refnamediv.refpurpose: arbitrarily long list of output arguments

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A function whose output argument list ends with varargout may be called with more output arguments than indicated in the output argument list. The Left-Hand-Side output arguments passed at calling time from the varargout keyword onwards are extracted out of the varargout list defined in the function.
varargout = function ex() may be called with any number of output arguments. Within function ex output arguments may be stored in varargout(i).
[X1,...,Xn,varargout] = function ex() may also be used. In this case the Xi variables must be assigned in the function as well as varargout(i).
argn(1) returns the actual total number of output arguments.
refsection.note: varargout is by default initialized to list().

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
function varargout = exampl() varargout = list(1,2,3,4) endfunction
x = exampl() [x, y] = exampl() [x, y, z] = exampl()
function [a,b,varargout]=exampl1() a = 'first' b = 'second' varargout = list(1,2,3,4) endfunction
exampl1() [a, b] = exampl1() [a,b,c] = exampl1()

revision.revdescription: varargout is now initialized to list() by default.
